src:
Pavkov propušta Bajern
Snažni golgeter iz Begeča povredio se u finišu utakmice, prilikom doskoka, zbog čega je ambulantnim kolima odveden sa stadiona

07 Nov 2019

Milan Pavkov će odustvovati tri nedelje zbog povrede skočnog zgloba na utakmici sa Totenhemom u Beogradu, pa je izvesno da neće biti na raspolaganju Vladanu Milojeviću u utakmici 5. kola grupne faze takmičenja protiv Bajerna 26. novembra na stadionu Rajko Mitić.
Snažni golgeter iz Begeča povredio se u finišu utakmice, prilikom doskoka, zbog čega je ambulantnim kolima odveden sa stadiona. Na današnjem pregledu je utvrđeno da je neophodna pauza, kako bi se povreda u potpunosti sanirala.
Vladan Milojević na raspolaganju ima još dvojicu napadača, Ričmonda Boaćija i Tomanea, koji će konkurisati za meč sa Javorom u subotu od 14.30 na Gradskom stadionu u Ivanjici.
Pavkov je ove sezone postigao osam golova na 18 utakmica u svim takmičenjima, a u jučerašnjoj utakmici protiv Totenhema imao je idealnu priliku da zatrese mrežu Paula Gazanige u prvom poluvremenu, ali nije uspeo.
Foto: Star Sport
text:
Pavkov misses Bayern
Strong goalkeeper from Begec injured himself in the finish line of the match, when he was hit, which caused him to be taken by ambulance from the stadium

07 Nov 2019

Milan Pavkov will be leaving for three weeks due to a ankle injury at a game against Tottenham in Belgrade, so it is certain that he will not be available to Vladan Milojevic in the game of the 5th round of the group stage against Bayern on November 26 at Rajko Mitic Stadium.
A strong goalie from Begec injured himself in the finish of the game, when he was hit, which caused him to be taken by ambulance from the stadium. Today's review found that a break was needed to fully repair the injury.
Vladan Milojevic has two other strikers at his disposal, Richmond Boaci and Tomane, who will compete for a match with Javor on Saturday at 2.30pm at Ivanjica City Stadium.
Pavkov scored eight goals in 18 games in all competitions this season, and in yesterday's game against Tottenham he had the ideal opportunity to shake off Paul Gazaniga's net in the first half, but failed.
Photo: Star Sport
